channel.title: Comments on: Missing Source
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Yitzhak
item.dc:creator: Yitzhak
item.description: FWIW, I see that <a href="http://www.yeshiva.org.il/midrash/Hmidrash.aspx?orderby=64" rel="nofollow">R. David Dov Levanon</a> maintains <a href="http://www.yeshiva.org.il/midrash/shiur.asp?id=2444" rel="nofollow">that the passage in Nedarim refers to the Second Temple</a>.
item.content:encoded: FWIW, I see that R. David Dov Levanon maintains that the passage in Nedarim refers to the Second Temple.

item.title: By: Daat Yachid
item.dc:creator: Daat Yachid
item.description: Oops, my keen homiletic sense seems to have caused me to overlook that small point ;-) I wonder if the pulpit rabbi also did?
item.content:encoded: Oops, my keen homiletic sense seems to have caused me to overlook that small point I wonder if the pulpit rabbi also did?

item.title: By: tomerpersico
item.dc:creator: tomerpersico
item.content:encoded:
I would guess it can be 爪注 , :

“专 专’ 专 专砖 注 砖 转专 转 砖注 注 转专 注 驻 砖专转 ”

Thus we learned the letter of the Law, but did not know how to add some common sense and Chesed to it, which in practicality is always essential.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2010/07/12/missing-source/#comment-1302">Daat Yachid</a>.
You have a good homiletic sense to work backwards from "message meant for us on a practical level" to the Ran. Don't you read Nedarim as applying to the First Temple?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Daat Yachid.

You have a good homiletic sense to work backwards from “message meant for us on a practical level” to the Ran.
Don’t you read Nedarim as applying to the First Temple?

item.title: By: Daat Yachid
item.dc:creator: Daat Yachid
item.description: 驻 转 住转 专 (祝 驻, ), 转 住转 专 专抓 转 "砖 专 转专 转"
item.content:encoded: 驻 转 住转 专 (祝 驻, ), 转 住转 专 专抓 转 “砖 专 转专 转”
